sen.j: 貞観式（じょうがんしき）は、平安時代初期に編纂・施行された格式。
sen.e: Jogan-shiki Code was a Kyakushiki code (amendments and enforcement regulations (of the ritsuryo)) that was compiled and enforced in the early Heian period.
Jogan-shiki Code was a Kyakushiki code (amendments and enforcement regulations of the Ritsuryo Code) that was compiled and enforced in the early Heian period.
sen.cmt: 括弧の数が多いので減らしました。また律令はローマ字のみでは意味が伝わらないためcodeを入れ、さらに大文字表記にしました。
sen.e: Jogan-shiki Code was a Kyakushiki code (amendments and enforcement regulations of the Ritsuryo Code) that was compiled and enforced in the early Heian period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: Totally 20 volumes.
It consists of 20 volumes in total.
sen.cmt: totallyは「まったく」の意でこの場合不適当なため、主語も補って書き直しました。
sen.e: It consists of 20 volumes in total.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 清和天皇の貞観 (日本)年間に藤原氏宗・南淵年名・大江音人・菅原是善・紀安雄・大春日安永・布瑠道永・山田弘宗の8名によって編纂が行われた。
sen.e: In the Jogan era, the times of Emperor Seiwa, it was compilated by eight members: FUJIWARA no Ujimune, MINABUCHI no Toshina, OE no Otondo, SUGAWARA no Koreyoshi, KI no Yasuo, OOKASUGA no Yasunaga, FURU no Michinaga, and YAMADA no Hiromune.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Jogan era, the times of Emperor Seiwa, it was compilated by eight members: FUJIWARA no Ujimune, MINABUCHI no Toshina, OE no Otondo, SUGAWARA no Koreyoshi, KI no Yasuo, OOKASUGA no Yasunaga, FURU no Michinaga, and YAMADA no Hiromune.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In the Jogan era, the times of Emperor Seiwa, it was compilated by eight members: FUJIWARA no Ujimune, MINABUCHI no Toshina, OE no Otondo, SUGAWARA no Koreyoshi, KI no Yasuo, OOKASUGA no Yasunaga, FURU no Michinaga, and YAMADA no Hiromune.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そして貞観13年8月25日 (旧暦)（871年9月13日）に奏進され、同年10月22日 (旧暦)（同年12月7日）の勅によって施行された。
sen.e: And on August 25, 871(the old calender)(September 13, 871 acccording to the solar calender), the Jogan-shiki code was submitted to the Emperor, and on October 22, the same year (the old calender)(December 7, the same year), it went into effect as an Imperial Ordinance.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then on September 13, 871, the Jogan-shiki Code was submitted to the Emperor, and on December 7 the same year it went into effect as an Imperial Ordinance.
sen.cmt: 標準的なアメリカ英語は表記の際Andで始めないためThen に置き換えました。またJogan-shiki Codeがcodeと小文字になっていたので修正しました。日付は西暦のみの表記にしました。
sen.e: Then on September 13, 871, the Jogan-shiki Code was submitted to the Emperor, and on December 7 the same year it went into effect as an Imperial Ordinance.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 既存の『弘仁式』を増訂・追補した諸規定・細則を集めて編纂し、『弘仁式』を廃止することなく、両方を併用する方式を採った。
sen.e: The Jogan-shiki code was compiled from the existing "Konin-shiki Code" (the supplemental law determined in the Konin era), unifying corrected and supplemented rules and detailed regulations, and both codes were used together without abolishing the "Konin-shiki Code".

The Jogan-shiki Code was compiled from the existing "Konin-shiki Code" (the supplemental law determined in the Konin era), unifying corrected and supplemented rules and detailed regulations, and both codes were used together without abolishing the "Konin-shiki Code".
sen.cmt: Jogan-shiki Codeのcodeを大文字にしました。
sen.e: The Jogan-shiki Code was compiled from the existing "Konin-shiki Code" (the supplemental law determined in the Konin era), unifying corrected and supplemented rules and detailed regulations, and both codes were used together without abolishing the "Konin-shiki Code".
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: なお、『弘仁式』にある条文を改訂した場合には、その条文に「前式（さきのしき）」と明示して、その後に「今案（いまあんずるに）」という書き出しを用いて改訂内容を記載する表記法を取った。
sen.e: When some provisions in the "Konin-shiki Code" was revised, such provision was specified as 'Sasanoshiki' (literally, previous code) followed by the revised contents, which began with an incipit, 'Ima-anzuruni' (literally, present idea).

Also, in case of revising articles of Konin-shiki, people were supposed to write''sakinoshiki (previous code)'' in the article, and after that ''Ima mazuruni (present idea)'' as the starting phrases and then write the content.
sen.cmt: 改訂することを前提で作ったわけではないので、whenの代わりにin case ofを挿入し、それに合うよう変更しました。また記入の順序が分かりやすくなるよう並べ替えました。
sen.e: Also, in case of revising articles of Konin-shiki, people were supposed to write''sakinoshiki (previous code)'' in the article, and after that ''Ima mazuruni (present idea)'' as the starting phrases and then write the content.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: このため、編纂期間は短縮されて巻数も『弘仁式』の半分に収まった。
sen.e: For this reason, the compilation time was reduced and the total volumes were a half of those of the "Konin-shiki Code".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it took less time to compile, and the number of volumes were reduced to half of ''Koninshiki''.
sen.cmt: 「このため」はより簡潔なthereforeで置き換えました。また編纂期間は結果的にかかった時間と判断し、take timeの表現で書き直しました。
sen.e: Therefore, it took less time to compile, and the number of volumes were reduced to half of ''Koninshiki''.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その一方で『弘仁式』と『貞観式』の両方を参照しなければならなかった。
sen.e: However, on the other hand, both the "Konin-shiki Code" and the "Jogan-shiki Code" had to be referred.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, both the "Konin-shiki Code" and the "Jogan-shiki Code" had to be referred to.
sen.cmt: 「その一方で」はon the other handのみで充分なのでhoweverを削除しました。またreferに目的語がある場合はtoが必要なので付け加えました。
sen.e: On the other hand, both the "Konin-shiki Code" and the "Jogan-shiki Code" had to be referred to.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そのため却って不便を生じ、後に全面的改訂を施した『延喜式』を編纂して、『弘仁式』・『貞観式』の施行を停止する一因となった。
sen.e: It was rather inconvenience and led to the compilation of full-fledged revision, the "Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers) and the abolishment of the "Konin-shiki Code" and the "Jogan-shiki Code".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result, it became less practical, which would later make a reason to compile the fully-revised ''Engishiki Code (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers)'' and to abolish the "Konin-shiki Code" and the "Jogan-shiki Code".
sen.cmt: 「そのため」の訳としてas a resultを付け加えました。また「却って」を比較級(less)で、「不便」を(less) practicalに修正しました。また「一因」の訳が抜けていたためa reasonを補い、それに合うよう部分的に書き直しました。
sen.e: As a result, it became less practical, which would later make a reason to compile the fully-revised ''Engishiki Code (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers)'' and to abolish the "Konin-shiki Code" and the "Jogan-shiki Code".
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 現在では一部が逸文として残されているものの、大部分が散逸している。
sen.e: Now, most of the text were lost although a portion remained as fragments.
Although some parts remain as quotes today, most parts have been scattered and lost.
sen.cmt: Althoughは基本的に文頭で用いるため語順を変えました。また逸文の訳quotes及び散逸の意味をなすようscatteredを付け加えました。
sen.e: Although some parts remain as quotes today, most parts have been scattered and lost.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
